author: @EAOmedia
title: Смертельные укусы - как насекомые могут убить, рассказала аллерголог | Science | Seldon News
text: Названа единственная аллергия, от которой нет лекарства Смертельными могут быть укусы шмелей, ос, пчел, предупредила россиян аллерголог Надежда Логина. По ее словам, эти насекомые выделяют яд, способный спровоцировать инсектную аллергию. Она развивается практически так же, как аллергия на медицинские препараты. При укусе жалящего насекомого возможны следующие реакции: анафилактический шок или отек Квинке. Если ничего не предпринять, вероятен летальный исход, объяснила врач. "Инсектная аллергия — это единственный вид аллергии, которая не лечится", — добавила она. Можно лишь купировать... Copyright information of photo and video materials was taken from the website «EAOmedia» , more details in our Terms of Service

author: BakersfieldNow Staff
title: chevron-right
text: BAKERSFIELD, Calif. (KBAK/KBFX) — While the news can often be full of crimes and scandals going on in the community, there are a few moments every year that restore your faith in humanity. Some of those moments came from the men and women in uniform this year. There were multiple moments throughout the year where they took time to save, help, and love on the community that they serve. But the first situation did not start out very good, but we promise. It has a good ending. In July, [a mobile home caught on fire in Arvin.](https://bakersfieldnow.com/news/local/video-arvin-officer-braves-flames-and-smoke-to-save-chained-dog-from-raging-mobile-home-fire-kern-county-arvin-police-department#) The family was able to escape safely but they left [ a dog chained up to the fence,](https://bakersfieldnow.com/news/local/video-arvin-officer-braves-flames-and-smoke-to-save-chained-dog-from-raging-mobile-home-fire-kern-county-arvin-police-department#) leaving a life-or-death situation for the pup. That's when [ Officer Adam Calderon](https://bakersfieldnow.com/news/local/heroic-arvin-police-officer-braves-flames-to-rescue-trapped-dog-feet-from-house-fire-bakersfield-kern-safety) jumped in to save the day. The tense moments caught on the officer’s body camera showed him struggling trying to get the dog free. "Come on doggy, I'm trying." And at moments, it looked like it would be impossible. "Please, I am trying to save you boy. Come on." [Officer Calderon told Eyewitness News,](https://bakersfieldnow.com/news/local/heroic-arvin-police-officer-braves-flames-to-rescue-trapped-dog-feet-from-house-fire-bakersfield-kern-safety) "When I was trying to shelter the dog, my back was burning, and I honestly thought I was going to give up. I was saying ‘Lord help me’ cause I honestly couldn’t do it." Eventually, he found some pruning shears. After trying to cut the chain for a few minutes, he was able to rescue the dog. PETA gave him the [ Compassionate Action Award.](https://bakersfieldnow.com/news/local/arvin-police-officers-heroic-rescue-of-chained-dog-from-burning-home-earns-peta-award-kern-county-arvin) Another moment of good caught during a very tense time was during a standoff in Oildale. This time the deputy took a moment during the chaos of the dangerous situation to hold and protect an [ innocent little girl as she was seen crossing the street riding her scooter to safety.](https://bakersfieldnow.com/newsletter-daily/kern-county-sheriffs-deputy-helps-girl-ride-scooter-amid-standoff-kcso-kern-county-sheriffs-office-bakersfield-oildale) They aren't the only department helping the younger generation. [CHP Buttonwillow Officer Pense helped deliver a baby on Taft Highway.](https://bakersfieldnow.com/news/local/highway-patrol-officers-turn-stork-for-a-day-deliver-baby-girl-on-taft-highway-california-highway-patrol-kern-county) After the hectic delivery, the officer even went and visited the [baby named Daleyza at her home a month later.](https://bakersfieldnow.com/news/local/chp-officer-pays-heartwarming-visit-to-the-baby-girl-he-helped-deliver-on-taft-highway-kern-county-bakersfield-california-highway-patrol-buttonwillow) The mom and baby are healthy. Moving on to perhaps one of the most talked about things in the history of our county, the lottery. A [winning lottery ticket was sold right here in Kern County.](https://bakersfieldnow.com/news/local/california-lottery-officials-speak-after-record-setting-powerball-ticket-sold-at-frazier-park-store-midway-market-liquors-kern-county-bakersfield-los-angeles) "Someone is waking up this morning with a billion-dollar piece of paper." The jackpot was the second largest in lottery history totaling over $1.7 billion. The ticket was sold at [ Midway Market and Liquor in Frazier Park.](https://bakersfieldnow.com/news/local/jackpot-jitters-local-liquor-store-lands-lottery-legend-status-after-selling-billion-dollar-ticket) Some may call it luck or fate but all we know is that person beat the 1 in 302,575,350 odds. That being said, no one has come forward to claim the prize, but the owners of the market were still given $1 million for being the lucky store. "Hopefully we can give back to the community, have a little party in the parking lot." One Bakersfield native, may not have won the lottery but was hoping to win some money when she appeared for the second time on Jeopardy. [Eesha Sohail](https://bakersfieldnow.com/search?find=Eesha%20Sohail) is a Stockdale High grad who went on Jeopardy as a contestant for their high school reunion episode. Unfortunately, she did not win, but she represented Kern County well in the game show competition. And speaking of competition, [ Bakersfield Christian alum Derek Carr and Liberty High alum Jordan Love ](https://bakersfieldnow.com/news/local/bakersfield-natives-derek-carr-and-jordan-love-set-for-nfl-face-off-a-tale-of-two-careers)faced off in a head-to-head in a friendly rivalry NFL game. The two played against each other on their professional teams: the New Orleans Saints and the Green Bay Packers. [Carr's family let us know what they wished was the outcome.](https://bakersfieldnow.com/news/local/derek-carrs-father-breaks-down-matchup-with-bako-qb-love) "I hope that Love has a good game but that the Saints win." That wish did not come true as Jordan Love’s team, the Packers, ultimately came out victorious. They were not the only athletes to make headlines in Kern County. Two athletes reached out to help a boy who was allegedly being bullied in Arvin. A video went viral on social media showing a group of [Arvin High School students shaving a boy’s head against his will.](https://bakersfieldnow.com/news/local/alleged-bullying-at-arvin-high-school-caught-on-video-khsd-responds) Micah Parsons from the Dallas Cowboys and Marcus Smart from the Memphis Grizzles both posted on social media saying they wanted to help the young boy and give him some fun merch. Marcus posted on X, formerly known as Twitter, saying, "Thank you everyone for the help! I have made contact. I wish everyone understand love is spread in multiple ways. Don't wait until we see pain and suffering. Let’s continue to make strides in protecting our youth!" There was another young kid from Kern County who got the support of a celebrity. [Delilah Loya](https://bakersfieldnow.com/news/local/local-girl-fighting-cancer-receives-special-visit-from-plain-white-ts-singer) has been battling cancer for four years. She has had 30 rounds of chemo and radiation. "They told us she had stage four neuroblastoma cancer and it's 95 percent of her bone marrow and she said specifically she is going to have to fight for her life." Which is why she needed a little encouragement and help from one of her favorite celebrities. Delilah was named after the song "Hey There Delilah." and Tom Higgenson, the lead singer of the Plain White T's who sang that song gave her a little surprise. Which did exactly what it was intended to do, put a smile on her face. "I was just like oh my gosh, and I just did this face."

author: Mónica Millán Valera
title: Estos son los síntomas más habituales que tendrás por falta de magnesio
text: Estos son los síntomas más habituales que tendrás por falta de magnesio Es un mineral esencial que desempeña un papel fundamental en múltiples funciones del cuerpo humano [Este es el alimento más rico en magnesio que debes tomar si te encuentras cansado y débil](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/nutricion/2024-01-19/alimento-mas-rico-en-magnesio-cansado-y-debil_3814199/) [Una farmacéutica cuenta los momentos en los que toma citrato de magnesio](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/nutricion/2024-07-06/farmaceutica-momentos-toma-citrato-magnesio_3880835/) El magnesio es un mineral esencial que desempeña un papel fundamental en múltiples funciones del cuerpo humano. A pesar de su importancia, muchas personas no obtienen la [cantidad diaria recomendada](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/nutricion/2024-07-17/farmaceutica-advierte-tiempo-tomar-citrato-magnesio-1qrt_3925012/), lo que puede desencadenar problemas de salud. Este mineral es clave para el correcto funcionamiento de los músculos y el sistema nervioso, así como para la regulación de los niveles de azúcar en la sangre y la presión arterial. Además, el magnesio interviene en la formación de proteínas, huesos y en la síntesis de ADN, por lo que su deficiencia puede tener consecuencias significativas. ¿Qué causa la deficiencia de magnesio? Existen varias causas que pueden llevar a una deficiencia de magnesio en el organismo. Entre las más comunes se encuentran el consumo excesivo de alcohol, diarrea crónica, desnutrición y ciertas enfermedades que afectan la absorción de nutrientes, como la celiaquía y la enfermedad inflamatoria intestinal. También, algunos medicamentos, como los [diuréticos o el omeprazol](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/nutricion/2024-07-26/tomas-medicamentos-debes-tomar-citrato-magnesio-1qrt_3931722/), pueden reducir los niveles de magnesio en el cuerpo. Otras condiciones como la sudoración excesiva, quemaduras que afectan grandes áreas del cuerpo y trastornos renales también pueden contribuir a una disminución significativa de este mineral en el organismo. Dado que el magnesio es vital para el buen funcionamiento de órganos como el corazón y los [ riñones](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/nutricion/2023-08-31/lo-que-tienes-que-comer-cuidar-rinones_2991628/), mantener niveles adecuados es crucial para la salud general. Síntomas Cuando los niveles de magnesio en el cuerpo son bajos, es posible que experimentes una serie de síntomas que pueden variar en intensidad. Algunos de los más comunes son: - Fatiga - Náuseas - Vómitos - Debilidad muscular En casos más graves, la deficiencia de magnesio, conocida médicamente como hipomagnesemia, puede causar convulsiones, espasmos musculares y movimientos anormales de los ojos, como el nistagmo. [Una chica cuenta por qué tuvo que dejar de tomar citrato de magnesio](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/nutricion/2024-04-22/tuve-que-dejar-tomar-citrato-magnesio-por-que_3871542/) Además de estos síntomas, la falta de magnesio puede provocar entumecimiento y hormigueo en las extremidades, lo que puede ser especialmente molesto y afectar la calidad de vida. Es fundamental estar atento a estos signos, ya que pueden indicar la necesidad de ajustar la dieta o considerar suplementos bajo la supervisión de un profesional de la salud. Qué alimentos tienen magnesio Para asegurar una ingesta adecuada de magnesio, es recomendable consumir [alimentos ricos en este minera](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/nutricion/2024-01-26/alimentos-contienen-magnesio-forma-natural-especialista_3818822/)l. Entre los más destacados se encuentran las verduras de hoja verde, como las espinacas, y los frutos secos, como las almendras y las nueces. También se puede encontrar en alimentos como el chocolate, el maíz y las legumbres. Si bien es posible obtener la cantidad necesaria de magnesio a través de la dieta, en algunos casos puede ser necesario recurrir a [suplementos](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/nutricion/2024-06-29/que-es-citrato-de-magnesio-complemento-dieta_3812125/), especialmente si existen factores que aumentan el riesgo de deficiencia. Consultar a un profesional de la salud es la mejor opción para determinar la necesidad de suplementación y para asegurarse de mantener este mineral en niveles óptimos para una salud equilibrada. [Este es el alimento más rico en magnesio que debes tomar si te encuentras cansado y débil](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/nutricion/2024-01-19/alimento-mas-rico-en-magnesio-cansado-y-debil_3814199/) [Una farmacéutica cuenta los momentos en los que toma citrato de magnesio](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/nutricion/2024-07-06/farmaceutica-momentos-toma-citrato-magnesio_3880835/) El magnesio es un mineral esencial que desempeña un papel fundamental en múltiples funciones del cuerpo humano. A pesar de su importancia, muchas personas no obtienen la [cantidad diaria recomendada](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/nutricion/2024-07-17/farmaceutica-advierte-tiempo-tomar-citrato-magnesio-1qrt_3925012/), lo que puede desencadenar problemas de salud. [Salud](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/tags/temas/salud-6110/) - [Cuándo tomar creatina para aumentar la masa muscular: estos son los alimentos ricos en esta sustancia](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/bienestar/2024-08-29/creatina-ejercicio-masa-muscular-dosis-cantidades-recomendables_3951382/)P. M. - [El mapa de los microbios de tu comida: descifran el microbioma más completo jamás logrado de cientos de alimentos](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/nutricion/2024-08-29/microbioma-mas-completo-de-cientos-alimentos-que-comemos_3951617/)A.G. - [Estos son los 5 alimentos que debes comer a diario, según una nutricionista de Harvard](https://www.alimente.elconfidencial.com/nutricion/2024-08-29/5-alimentos-comer-diario-nutricionista-harvard-1qrt_3951703/)Alimente

author: Shaheer Shahzad
title: This Swiss Solar Truck Just Set A New Altitude Record – At 6,500 Meters
text:
An amazing 6,500 meters above sea level has been reached by the solar-powered electric vehicle (EV) Terren, setting a new altitude record in the field of sustainable mobility. This remarkable achievement, which demonstrated the viability of greener technology in harsh environments, happened on an expedition to the western slope of Ojos del Salado, the highest active volcano on Earth, in Chile.
Developed by Patrik Koller, CEO and developer at Peak Evolution, the Terren is a modified truck based on Aebi Schmidt’s Aebi VT450 Transporter. The electric multi-purpose vehicle boasts a 90-kilowatt-hour battery, providing a range of 124 miles, with the production version capable of accommodating a larger 140-kilowatt-hour battery for extended travel capabilities.
The Terren’s power is harnessed from two Bosch electric motors, delivering a combined 320-horsepower output and a remarkable 70 percent increase in efficiency, all while weighing half as much as its diesel counterpart. Swiss battery specialist EcoVolta contributes to the vehicle’s technological edge, with adjustments in power electronics ensuring high-altitude resilience.
Notably, the Terren features a redundancy system of three parallel battery packs, enhancing durability and ensuring seamless operation even if one pack is damaged. The vehicle’s lightweight, sturdy body comprises thermally insulating composite sandwich panels, a result of collaborative efforts from 3A Composites, SIKA, and Glas Trösch.
The journey of Terren began eight weeks ago when logistics firm Gebrüder Weiss initiated transportation from Switzerland. The solar-powered truck traveled through Rotterdam via sea freight to reach Chile, where it underwent challenging overland transport to reach the Atacama region’s demanding terrain.
The expedition faced rigorous conditions at the world’s highest volcano, testing not only the vehicle’s advanced technology but also the physical and mental resilience of the team. In late November, the Terren achieved a significant milestone by surpassing the 6,000-meter mark for electric vehicles, ultimately reaching the unprecedented altitude of 6,500 meters above sea level.
With the world record secured, the Peak Evolution team is now heading back to Switzerland, leaving behind a trail of innovation, efficiency, and collaboration in the pursuit of sustainable off-road excellence. The Terren’s success marks a significant step forward for alternative drives and their potential applications in demanding transport tasks, such as mining and exploration in challenging terrains.

author: Jornal do Comércio
title: Temporal com ventos de 90 km/h causa estragos no RS
text:
A última sexta-feira de 2023 começou com transtornos causados pelas chuvas em várias cidades do Rio Grande do Sul . A madrugada e a manhã deste dia 29 de dezembro foram marcadas por temporais, raios, trovoadas e rajadas de vento que chegaram a 90 km/h . • LEIA TAMBÉM: Litoral Norte amanhece com vento, nuvens escuras e chuva
Segundo a Defesa Civil do Estado, ocorreram estragos em Cândido Godói, Cerro Largo,
Giruá, Horizontina, Santa Rosa, Santo Cristo, São Luiz Gonzaga, São Nicolau e Tucunduva. Em Ubiretama, a cobertura de uma quadra esportiva caiu , mas a Defesa Civil ainda não tem mais informações sobre o ocorrido e diz que não foram reportados feridos.
A MetSul Meteorologia fez um levantamento das rajadas de vento às 7h da manhã desta sexta-feira. Em São Vicente do Sul e São Borja, os ventos chegaram a 90 km/h.
Em Porto Alegre, a precipitação acumulada da 0h às 8h somava 31 mm segundo a estação do Instituto Nacional de Meteorologia (Inmet) no Jardim Botânico. Houve registro de queda de árvores e pontos de água acumulada em algumas ruas da cidade.
Cerca de 236 mil clientes estão sem luz , principalmente em áreas atendidas pela RGE nas regiões Norte e Missões. Maiores rajadas de vento no Rio Grande do Sul até 7h da manhã segundo a MetSul: São Vicente do Sul: 90 km/h São Borja: 90 km/h Maçambará: 87 km/h São Luiz Gonzaga: 85 km/h Júlio de Castilhos: 84 km/h Soledade: 80 km/h Livramento: 75 km/h Quaraí: 73 km/h São Martinho da Serra: 70 km/h Tupanciretã: 70 km/h

author: Ravi Kumar Jha
title: First Look: Hugo Ekitike wears Liverpool Red after official move
text:
Liverpool have finally got their man as they signed Hugo Ekitike from Eintracht Frankfurt on a €95 million deal. The huge amount is for the talent they are pursuing and for the next season titles. The reigning champions of Premier League isn’t stopping in the summer transfer window as they already did 4 top class signings. The club is expected to go for few more signings as Arne Slot wants a huge change in the squad.
Liverpool have made a major statement in the summer transfer window by completing the signing of Hugo Ekitike from Eintracht Frankfurt in a blockbuster €95 million deal. The 22-year-old French forward had been on the Reds’ radar for months, and they’ve finally got their man.
Ekitike’s arrival signals Liverpool’s ambition under new manager Arne Slot, who is keen to reshape the squad in pursuit of more silverware. The reigning Premier League champions have now made four top-class signings this window, with Ekitike becoming the marquee addition.
The hefty price tag reflects both the talent Ekitike possesses and the club’s long-term vision. A dynamic and versatile attacker, he is expected to add flair and firepower to Liverpool’s frontline, which already boasts the likes of Mohamed Salah and Darwin Núñez.

author: Joshua Bartholomew
title: Alarming Security Bugs Lurk in Linux’s Needrestart Utility for a Decade
text:
In a discovery that has sent ripples through the Linux community, security researchers at Qualys have uncovered five critical vulnerabilities in needrestart, a widely used utility in Linux distributions. These vulnerabilities, present for over ten years, could allow attackers to escalate privileges and gain complete control of affected systems. The flaws, deemed “alarming” by Qualys, highlight the importance of continuous vigilance even in seemingly benign tools.
needrestart is a utility that informs system administrators about services needing a restart after software updates. It’s a crucial component in ensuring system stability and security by facilitating the use of the latest software versions. However, these vulnerabilities, present since version 0.8 released in 2014, could be exploited by malicious actors to gain unauthorized root access.
Vulnerabilities and their Impact: The vulnerabilities, tracked as CVE-2024-48990, CVE-2024-48991, CVE-2024-48992, CVE-2024-10224, and CVE-2024-11003, stem from various coding oversights. These include issues like:
Race conditions: Where multiple processes access and manipulate shared resources simultaneously, leading to unpredictable behavior. Insecure handling of environment variables: Allowing attackers to manipulate variables like RUBYLIB to inject malicious code. Lack of proper validation: Failing to adequately check interpreter binaries, enabling attackers to substitute them with malicious executables. Exploiting these vulnerabilities, attackers could potentially execute arbitrary code with root privileges. This could lead to complete system compromise, data breaches, and disruption of services.
Who is Affected? While needrestart is prevalent across various Linux distributions, Ubuntu Server users are particularly vulnerable. The utility is installed by default on Ubuntu Server since version 21.04, making it a prime target for attackers. Given Ubuntu Server’s popularity, especially in cloud environments and server deployments, the number of potentially affected systems could be significant.
Addressing the Vulnerabilities: Qualys, while refraining from releasing exploit code to prevent widespread abuse, has responsibly disclosed the vulnerabilities and worked with the developers to release a patched version. Users are strongly urged to update to needrestart version 3.8 or later to mitigate these risks.
The Importance of Continuous Security Assessment: This incident serves as a stark reminder of the importance of continuous security assessment and vigilance. Even mature and widely used tools can harbor hidden vulnerabilities that could be exploited by malicious actors . Regular audits, code reviews, and penetration testing are crucial to identify and address such weaknesses before they can be exploited.
My Perspective: As someone deeply involved in system administration and security, this discovery is both concerning and enlightening. It underscores the need for a proactive approach to security, where we don’t just react to incidents but actively seek out and address potential vulnerabilities. It also highlights the crucial role of security researchers and the responsible disclosure process in ensuring the safety and stability of our digital infrastructure.
Delving Deeper into the Vulnerabilities: Let’s take a closer look at the individual vulnerabilities and their potential impact:
CVE-2024-48990: This vulnerability involves improper handling of temporary files, allowing attackers to manipulate them and potentially gain elevated privileges. CVE-2024-48991: A race condition exists during the validation of interpreter binaries, enabling attackers to replace them with malicious ones. CVE-2024-48992: Attackers can exploit the handling of the RUBYLIB environment variable to inject and execute malicious Ruby code. CVE-2024-10224 & CVE-2024-11003: These vulnerabilities involve the insecure processing of command-line arguments, potentially allowing attackers to execute arbitrary commands. The Role of the Community: The open-source nature of Linux plays a crucial role in identifying and addressing such vulnerabilities. The collaborative efforts of security researchers, developers, and the wider community are essential in ensuring the security and integrity of the Linux ecosystem. This incident highlights the strength of this collaborative model, where vulnerabilities are responsibly disclosed and promptly addressed.
Looking Ahead: While the immediate threat posed by these vulnerabilities can be mitigated by updating to the latest version of needrestart, it’s crucial to learn from this incident and take proactive steps to prevent similar occurrences in the future. This includes:
Enhanced code reviews: Implementing more rigorous code review processes to identify potential vulnerabilities early in the development cycle. Automated security testing: Integrating automated security testing tools into the development pipeline to catch vulnerabilities before they reach production. Increased community engagement: Encouraging wider community participation in security audits and vulnerability discovery. By embracing these measures, we can strengthen the security of the Linux ecosystem and ensure the continued trust and confidence of its users.
The discovery of these long-standing vulnerabilities in needrestart serves as a wake-up call for the Linux community. It underscores the importance of continuous vigilance, proactive security measures, and the collaborative spirit that defines the open-source world. By learning from this incident and taking proactive steps to enhance security, we can ensure a safer and more resilient Linux ecosystem for all.

author: Hermano Chiodi
title: Liberação da entrada de animais em hospitais avança em Belo Horizonte
text: A entrada de animais de pequeno porte nos hospitais de Belo Horizonte ganhou aval das Comissões da Câmara Municipal e agora segue para votação em plenário. Pela proposta, os “pets” poderão entrar nas unidades de saúde para visitar pacientes internados, desde que autorizados pelo médico e pela instituição. Como já houve uma votação em primeiro turno, se a proposta for aprovada vai para sanção do prefeito Fuad Noman (PSD). Na justificativa do Projeto de Lei, apresentado pelo vereador Wanderley Porto (PRD), o parlamentar argumenta que a presença de animais em hospitais pode ter um impacto significativo no bem-estar dos pacientes. “Estudos mostram que interações com animais podem reduzir a ansiedade, diminuir a pressão arterial e até mesmo diminuir a dor em pacientes hospitalizados. Além disso, a presença de animais de estimação pode ajudar a quebrar a monotonia e o isolamento”, diz. “É uma forma de trazer um pouco de alegria e conforto em um momento difícil e estressante”, afirma o vereador.
